items.title: SG investment manager launches $357m digital infra fund in China
items.summary:
- Singapore-based investment manager GLP launches the GLP China IDC Income Fund I with $357.76 million in assets.
- The fund will acquire an operational data center in the Greater Beijing region, leased to a major ecommerce company.
- This initiative responds to the rising global demand for data centers, expected to triple in the next three years, consuming significant energy resources.

items.title: ZTE appoints new chairman as it shifts to AI strategy
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- ZTE Corp appoints Fang Rong as new chairman, succeeding Li Zixue.
- Fang will collaborate with CEO Xu Ziyang in management.
- The company is transitioning to focus on AI to combat declining revenue in the carrier network business.
- ZTE aims to transform into a "connectivity plus computing" enterprise by 2025.
- Following the announcement, ZTE's stock prices rose slightly, with Hong Kong shares increasing by 1.89%.

items.title: VN startup banks on co-ops to defy agritech skeptics
items.author: Hao Diep
items.summary:
- Vietnam-based agritech firm TechCoop raised US$70 million in series A funding.
- The startup, founded by Hao Diep in 2022, focuses on trade credit financing for farming cooperatives.
- TechCoop projects annualized revenue of US$250 million by 2025 and US$400 million by 2026.
- The company partners with banks to offer financing for cooperatives, tracking and verifying transactions on its platform.
- Unlike traditional lending, TechCoop does not charge interest but makes gross margins from buying and selling agricultural products.

items.title: Google streamlines Gmail email encryption for businesses
items.summary:
- Google updates Gmail to make sending encrypted emails easier for enterprise users, rolling out in beta.
- Initial feature allows encrypted emails within organizations, with future plans for all Gmail users and third-party providers.
- New system replaces S/MIME protocol; users can enable additional encryption in email draft window.
- Recipients without S/MIME access messages via a guest Google Workspace account; those with S/MIME use the existing protocol.
- Client-side encryption offers stronger protection than default TLS, with workspace admins managing keys and monitoring files.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.summary:
- The article explores recent trends in Southeast Asia's funding landscape, analyzing investor activity and notable funding rounds.
- It comprises two main sections: a weekly update showcasing recent investors and companies, and a macro trends section that illustrates funding distribution across regions and sectors.
- Notable contributors to the content include infographics by Yeo Cheng Yong and editing by Terence Lee.

items.title: EU considers retaliation against US Big Tech over tariffs
items.summary:
- The European Union is preparing countermeasures against US tariffs effective Apr. 2.
- Potential actions may target tech companies like Google, Amazon, and X (formerly Twitter).
- Options include increased regulation, financial transaction taxes, and restrictions on access to EU public contracts.
- The Digital Markets Act may lead to rulings on violations by companies such as Apple and Meta.
- EU Commission President Ursula von der Leyen stated that all options are on the table for retaliation.
- The Anti-Coercion Instrument could be used but needs member state approval.
- Brussels is open to negotiations to resolve trade barriers and enhance cooperation with the US.

items.title: Apple AI adds Korean support, Find My feature in Korea
items.summary:
- Apple adds Korean-language support to its AI system, Apple Intelligence, which now also includes French, German, Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, Japanese, and Simplified Chinese.
- Features of Apple Intelligence include AI-powered writing tools, photo editing, mail and notification summaries, and voice recording transcription, emphasizing user privacy through on-device processing.
- The update also introduces the "Find My" location tracking feature in Korea, allowing users to track their devices on iPhones, iPads, and Apple Watches after over a decade of unavailability.

items.title: Google Cloud partners with Thailand to boost cybersecurity
items.summary:
- Thailand’s National Cyber Security Agency (NCSA) collaborates with Google Cloud for enhanced cyber resilience.
- The partnership utilizes AI-driven solutions and threat intelligence to safeguard public sector entities.
- Centralized monitoring through Google Cloud Cybershield will be implemented for security events in government agencies.
- The collaboration includes threat intelligence sharing and incident response training for cybersecurity professionals.
- Integration of Google Cloud Web Risk into government workflows will block unsafe websites with malware or phishing.
- Google’s anti-scam feature in Google Play Protect has blocked over 6.6 million high-risk app installations in Thailand since 2024.

items.title: Nvidia-backed AI firm CoreWeave shares surge after IPO debut
items.summary:
- CoreWeave’s shares surged over 18% on April 1 after a disappointing IPO debut.
- IPO price was lowered to US$40, after initially being set between US$47 to US$55.
- Stock opened at US$39 and closed at US$40, falling more than 10% on March 31.
- The company reported a net loss of US$863 million but had revenue growth of over 737%, reaching US$1.92 billion.
- CoreWeave competes with major players like Microsoft, Amazon, and Google, boasting a market cap of US$19 billion.

items.title: Menswear brand The Bear House bags $5.8m series A
items.summary:
- The Bear House (TBH), a Bengaluru-based menswear brand, raised 50 crore rupees (US$5.8 million) in a series A funding round led by JM Financial Private Equity.
- Funds will be used for offline store expansion, working capital, and branding efforts.
- Company reported significant growth in FY24, with net profit increasing to 11.2 crore (US$1.3 million) from 1.2 crore rupees (US$140,174) in FY23.
- Operating revenue increased by 79.5% to 96.2 crore rupees (US$11.2 million), and EBITDA improved to 11.4 crore rupees (US$1.3 million) from 2.5 crore rupees (US$292,038), raising the EBITDA margin to 12% from 5%.

items.title: Singapore issues Grab taxi operator license
items.summary:
- The Land Transport Authority (LTA) of Singapore has issued a 10-year Street-hail Service Operator Licence to Grab starting April 9.
- The licence is awarded to GrabCab, a subsidiary of Grab Rentals and sister company of GrabCar.
- The licence allows Grab to operate taxis for both street-hail and ride-hail services.
- Grab is now the sixth taxi company in Singapore, joining CityCab, Comfort Transportation, Prime Taxi, Strides Premier, and Trans-cab Services.
- GrabCab has a three-year grace period to expand its fleet to at least 800 taxis.
- Grab’s earlier proposed acquisition of Trans-cab Services was withdrawn in 2024 after regulatory review.

items.title: SG-based medtech firm considers IPO to raise up to $298m
items.summary:
- UltraGreen.ai, a Singapore-based medtech firm, is considering an IPO to raise up to S$400 million (US$298 million).
- The company is in talks with financial advisers for a potential listing in Singapore later this year, with the final size and timing still under discussion.
- If successful, this IPO would be significant as Singapore has not had any IPOs in 2025, following four IPOs that raised US$34.4 million in 2024, led by Singapore Institute of Advanced Medicine Holdings Pte’s US$19.5 million offering.
- UltraGreen.ai serves clients including Adventist Health, Cleveland Clinic, and Mayo Clinic.

items.title: Swiggy faces $18.5m tax assessment order
items.summary:
- Swiggy received a tax assessment order for outstanding dues of ₹158.25 crore (US$18.5 million).
- Dues are related to unpaid taxes on cancellation charges and interest income on tax refunds.
- Swiggy plans to challenge the order and asserts it won't significantly impact its finances.
- The company previously received notices for ₹1.1 crore (US$128,500) in unpaid dues for FY 2018 and 2019 regarding cancellation charges and intends to appeal those as well.
- Recent developments include expansion plans and financial performance updates linked to market conditions.

items.title: Samsung appoints new acting head of consumer division
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics appointed Roh Tae-moon as the acting head of its consumer and smartphone division.
- This change follows the death of former co-CEO Han Jong-Hee, who led the division.
- Roh will head the Device Experience (DX) division, which includes TV, home appliances, and smartphones.
- A decision on the co-CEO structure will be made by the company’s board later.
- Leadership changes aim to close gaps in the DX division amidst ongoing operational challenges.

items.title: Li Auto delivers 1 million hybrid SUVs in 31 months
items.summary:
- Li Auto, a Chinese electric vehicle manufacturer, has delivered over 1 million L-series SUVs in 31 months since their launch.
- The L-series includes models L7, L8, and L9, featuring extended-range hybrid systems for premium family users.
- In March 2025, Li Auto delivered over 28,000 vehicles amid a competitive EV market.

items.title: Indian first packaged semiconductor chip to launch by July
items.author: Raghu Panicker
items.summary:
- Kaynes Semicon is delivering India's first packaged semiconductor chip by July 2025.
- CEO Raghu Panicker stated the pilot project is nearing completion, with operations set to begin in May.
- Qualification testing in June will precede shipments to Alpha Omega Semiconductor, utilizing 60% of the facility's capacity.
- Kaynes acquired land in Sanand, Gujarat, for an OSAT unit with a 3,300 crore rupees investment.
- The facility will produce 6 million chips daily for various sectors including automotive and telecom.

items.title: Nio overhauls sub-brand Onvo EV leadership
items.summary:
- Nio has announced a leadership overhaul at its mass-market brand Onvo to improve sales and efficiency.
- Alan Ai Tiecheng stepped down as president of Onvo and as a senior vice president at Nio due to disappointing sales of the Onvo L60.
- Fei Shen, previously head of Nio's energy business, has been appointed as the new president of Onvo, reporting to co-founder Lihong Qin.
- Onvo's research and development, supply chain, and quality teams will now report directly to Nio CEO William Li.
- The restructuring aims to enhance Onvo’s sales performance as Nio targets profitability by Q4 2025.

items.title: US fashion-tech firm CaaStle CEO resigns over financial claims
Meta’s AI research head to step down in May
items.author: Joelle Pineau
items.summary:
- Joelle Pineau, head of AI research at Meta, will leave the company in May 2025 after eight years.
- She currently leads the Fundamental AI Research (FAIR) group, which has made strides in voice translation, image recognition, and the open-source large language model, Llama.
- Pineau stated it was time to create space for others, and plans to observe and reflect after her departure.
- Meta is actively searching for her successor.

items.title: Google, Roblox team up to enhance immersive in-game ads
items.summary:
- Google expands Immersive Ads to more publishers via AdMob and Ad Manager.
- Partnership with Roblox aims to enhance in-game advertising, integrating ads into virtual environments like digital billboards.
- New support for video ad formats makes implementation easier for advertisers.
- Roblox partnership will improve Rewarded Video and other immersive ad formats, enhancing user engagement in gaming.

items.title: Indian blockchain EV firm DeCharge raises $2.5m seed funding
items.author: Mohan Ponnada, Prakash Kamraj, Rama Krishna
items.summary:
- DeCharge, a blockchain EV startup in India, has raised $2.5 million in seed funding.
- Funding led by Lemniscap with contributions from Colosseum, Daedalus Angels, EV3 Labs, and others.
- Individual investors include Nom, creator of the memecoin BONK, and Arnold Lee from Spherelabs.
- Founded in 2024, DeCharge offers a decentralized EV charging network utilizing the Solana blockchain.
- Funding will aid expansion in the US, Europe, the Middle East, and emerging markets for VoltBox chargers.

items.title: Taiwanese chipmaker UMC denies merger talks with GlobalFoundries
items.summary:
- United Microelectronics Corp. (UMC) denied reports of a potential merger with GlobalFoundries.
- UMC stated no talks are happening, despite market speculation.
- UMC shares rose 2.02% to NT$45.55, while ADRs surged 9.16%.
- UMC holds a 4.7% share of the global pure-play wafer foundry market; GlobalFoundries has 4.6%.
- A merger would create a combined market share of 9.3%.

items.title: Zomato lays off 600 employees following AI integration
items.summary:
- Zomato lays off approximately 600 employees from its customer support team due to AI integration and restructuring.
- The layoffs are related to performance issues and come as Zomato’s AI platform, Nugget, improves customer support efficiency.
- The affected employees were part of the Zomato Associate Accelerator Program (ZAAP) and were hired less than a year ago, facing abrupt terminations without job renewals.
- These layoffs occur amid slowing growth in Zomato’s food delivery business and increased competition.

items.title: Taiwan proposes new crypto regulations for local platforms
items.summary:
- Taiwan's Financial Supervisory Commission (FSC) has drafted the 'Virtual Asset Service Act' to regulate the crypto industry.
- Both proposed regulations require local licensing for crypto platforms and permits for overseas providers to establish entities in Taiwan.
- Huang Shan-shan aims for the draft to be enacted by the end of 2025, with public feedback concluding on May 24 and submission to the Executive Yuan in June.
- This draft follows a failed attempt in 2023 to pass similar regulations, which are expected to raise compliance costs for providers to meet anti-money laundering requirements.
- Non-compliance may lead to fines or imprisonment, with suggestions for a tiered approach for smaller firms to ease regulatory burdens.

items.title: Japan’s Metaplanet acquires 696 BTC, expands crypto holdings
items.summary:
- Metaplanet acquired 696 bitcoin for 10.15 billion yen (US$67.9 million) at an average price of 14.59 million yen (US$97,512) per bitcoin.
- 645.74 BTC through options exercises and 50.26 BTC from premiums, netting a cost of 13.48 million yen (US$90,073) per bitcoin.
- Q1 2025 operating revenue was 770.35 million yen (US$5.2 million), an 11.4% increase from Q4 2024.
- Total BTC holdings now reach 4,046, valued at about US$340 million, among the top corporate holders globally.
- Plans to acquire 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025 and 21,000 BTC by 2026.
- Stock closed up 2% at 409 yen (US$2.73), reflecting a 1,950% increase over the past year.

items.title: TikTok’s faces uncertainty as deadline approaches on Apr. 5
items.author: The Business Times
items.summary:
- TikTok faces uncertainty as its deadline approaches on April 5.
- Legal and regulatory pressures are increasing for the platform.
- Stakeholders are concerned about the implications of potential actions taken by authorities.

items.title: Qualcomm acquires Vietnam’s VinAI AI unit
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Qualcomm acquires MovianAI, a generative AI division of VinAI, part of Vingroup ecosystem.
- Acquisition aims to improve Qualcomm’s R&D in generative AI for smartphones, PCs, and software-defined vehicles.
- Dr. Hung Bui, founder of VinAI, will join Qualcomm to leverage his expertise in AI, machine learning, and NLP.
- Jilei Hou from Qualcomm emphasizes the integration of VinAI talent for enhancing AI across industries.
- Acquisition strengthens Qualcomm’s collaboration with Vietnam’s tech sector, focused on 5G and IoT advancements.
- Financial terms of the acquisition are not disclosed.

items.title: Used-car platform Spinny bags $131m, hits $1.8b valuation
items.summary:
- Spinny raises $131 million in its latest funding round.
- The company is now valued at $1.8 billion.
- This funding will help Spinny expand its operations and improve services.

items.title: SEA logistics sees M&A, greentech action amid funding lull
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia's logistics and ecommerce sectors are impacted by a prolonged tech winter.
- Only ecommerce analytics firm AMP raised funding in 2025, securing US$12.7 million from Openspace Ventures and OneVentures.
- Major funding in logistics has been scarce, with Ninja Van obtaining US$50 million in a revolving credit facility from HSBC last October.
- Early-stage funding has been observed for greentech logistics firms like Dash Electric, Blitz Electric, and Mober in the previous year.
- A price war is escalating in Southeast Asia's logistics sector, particularly on ecommerce platforms.
- Shopee's increased reliance on its in-house logistics, SPX Express, threatens third-party logistics (3PLs) viability.
- J&T Express has seen success but faces challenges due to a recent ended partnership with Shopee in Indonesia, which could hurt shipment volumes.

items.title: TVS Motor acquires Ion Mobility assets for $1.7m
items.summary:
- TVS Motor acquired assets from Ion Mobility for $1.7 million, disclosed to BSE India.
- TVS previously invested over $24 million in Ion Mobility over two years.
- The specific assets purchased were not disclosed, nor the buyer of the divested stake.
- Ion Mobility's CEO, James Chan, confirmed the acquisition, stating TVS takes over all assets and IP.
- Chan will join TVS as senior VP on April 1, 2025, overseeing the ASEAN market.
- TVS plans to relaunch Ion's flagship M1-S electric scooter in markets outside Indonesia.
- Ion Mobility, founded in 2019, struggled as an independent entity despite funding and strong products.

items.title: EU may fine Meta up to $16b for violating ad rules
items.summary:
- The EU is set to fine Meta for its 'pay or consent' advertising model on Facebook and Instagram.
- A preliminary ruling found this model violates the Digital Markets Act (DMA).
- The decision follows a July 2024 finding that this model restricts user choice in ad personalization.
- Fines could reach up to 10% of Meta's annual revenue, potentially amounting to $16 billion based on 2024 earnings.
- If enforced, Meta will likely have to allow users to opt out of personalized ads without a fee.
- This may significantly affect Meta's revenue in Europe, which constitutes nearly 25% of its total income.

items.title: Taiwanese chipmaker UMC unveils $5b fab expansion in Singapore
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Taiwanese UMC opens a new semiconductor fabrication facility in Singapore.
- The first phase will begin production in 2026.
- UMC invested up to $5 billion for the facility, with a capacity of 30,000 wafers per month.
- The site will focus on 22nm and 28nm semiconductor processes for smartphones, IoT, automotive, and AI.
- UMC currently operates 12 fabrication facilities globally.

items.title: SpaceX to build first Starlink ground station in Vietnam
items.summary:
- SpaceX plans its first Starlink ground station in Vietnam, operating by May or June 2025 in Danang.
- Vietnam approved a five-year pilot program allowing Starlink, enabling SpaceX full ownership of its local subsidiary.
- The initial station investment is estimated at $3 million, but future project viability is uncertain due to potential US tariffs on trade surpluses, including Vietnam.
- Starlink operates in over 100 countries and connects users via ground stations and satellites, with independent estimates suggesting about 150 stations globally, half in the US.

items.title: DC-based Construct Capital closes third fund at $300m
items.author: Dayna Grayson, Rachel Holt
items.summary:
- Construct Capital raises $300 million for its third fund, focused on early-stage investments in manufacturing, transportation, and defense technology.
- This fund follows a successful 2022 funding round, including a $225 million second fund and a $75 million pool for later-stage investments.
- Founded in 2020, the firm has invested in companies like Hadrian and Veho.

items.title: Vietnam’s new currency: the QR code
items.summary:
- The rise of QR payments is transforming Vietnam's fintech landscape, with significant growth in cashless transactions.
- Fintech companies like MoMo and ZaloPay are evolving into AI-powered super apps to adapt to this shift.
- Vietnamese regulators are working on legalizing cryptocurrencies, with initiatives like a pilot crypto trading platform underway.

items.title: Meet the 80 top-funded startups and tech companies in Southeast Asia
Sunrate to buy China’s Transfar Pay for $43m to gain license
items.summary:
- Transfar Logistics to sell its entire stake in Transfar Pay to Sunrate for $43 million.
- The acquisition is aimed at gaining compliance advantages in China's regulated cross-border payments sector.
- The deal awaits approval from China’s central bank and other regulatory bodies, with uncertain timelines.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Southeast Asia
US voice tech startup Sesame AI eyes $200m funding
items.author: Brendan Iribe, Ankit Kumar
items.summary:
- Sesame AI Inc. is seeking over US$200 million in funding from investors.
- Funding round may be co-led by Sequoia Capital and Spark Capital, potentially valuing Sesame AI at over US$1 billion.
- Founded in 2023, Sesame AI launched in February 2023 after raising US$47.5 million in a Series A round.
- The company's voice assistants, Maya and Miles, focus on creating more natural and emotionally resonant interactions.

items.title: Microsoft-backed AI firm faces audit, leadership changes
items.summary:
- Builder.ai engages two Big Four auditing firms for financial review for 2023 and 2024.
- Revenue estimates for H2 2024 reduced by 25% due to underperforming sales.
- The company raised over US$450 million and began revising sales figures last summer.
- Concerns raised about inflated sales figures by over 20% by former employees.
- New CEO Manpreet Ratia expects audit findings this summer to improve transparency and governance.
- Leadership changes include founder Sachin Dev Duggal stepping down as CEO in February.
- Projected revenue increased to US$170 million in 2024 from US$140 million in 2023, despite slower growth in Australia and Southeast Asia.

items.title: AI-powered cybersecurity firm ReliaQuest raises over $500m
items.summary:
- ReliaQuest has raised over US$500 million in its latest funding round.
- The company is valued at US$3.4 billion following the investment.
- Major investors include EQT, KKR, FTV Capital, and existing investors Ten Eleven Ventures and Finback Investment Partners.
- Funds will be used to enhance GreyMatter, an AI-driven platform, and for global expansion.
- GreyMatter integrates with over 200 cybersecurity tools to enhance threat detection and response.
- ReliaQuest's annual recurring revenue exceeds US$300 million with over 30% year-over-year growth since 2020.
- Goldman Sachs acted as the exclusive financial advisor; Gibson Dunn provided legal counsel.

items.title: US pushes for more semiconductor investments under Chips Act
items.summary:
- Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick urges companies to increase investments in the US semiconductor sector.
- Seeking tens of billions in additional investments without increasing the $52 billion from the 2022 Chips and Science Act.
- TSMC's decision to invest an extra $100 billion in US facilities prompts this push.
- Potential withholding of already awarded subsidies if companies don't expand their plans.
- Lutnick interested in expanding the Chips Act’s 25% tax credit, which requires Congressional approval for any significant changes.
- Companies like Wolfspeed Inc. face uncertainty due to delays in fund disbursements.
- President Donald Trump criticized the Chips Act and created the United States Investment Accelerator to oversee large projects and fund distribution.

items.title: Xiaomi investigated after its EV fatal crash in China
items.summary:
- Xiaomi is cooperating with police after a fatal accident involving its SU7 electric vehicle on March 29 in Anhui, China.
- The vehicle was in Navigate on Autopilot mode, traveling at 116 km/h before the crash.
- The driver attempted to regain control but collided with a cement pole at 97 km/h; casualties remain undisclosed.
- The SU7 involved does not have advanced LiDAR technology and uses a vision-based system for navigation.
- Investigations are ongoing.

items.title: Fantasy gaming firm Dream11 moves HQ from US to India
items.summary:
- Fantasy gaming platform Dream11 relocated its headquarters from the US to India.
- The merger of US entity Dream Sports Inc. with Indian entity Sporta Technologies Pvt Ltd was approved by the board in January 2025.
- Reasons for the move include enabling US shareholders to participate in the Indian company, reducing costs by eliminating inter-company transactions, and simplifying management structure.
- No plans for a public listing in India have been announced.

items.title: Huawei reports first quarterly loss in years
items.summary:
- Huawei reported a net loss of 300 million yuan (approximately US$41.3 million) for the December quarter, marking its first quarterly loss in several years.
- Revenue increased by 9.5% to around 276 billion yuan (around US$38 billion).
- The company invested 179.7 billion yuan (around US$24.76 billion) in R&D for 2024, a 9.1% increase from 2023.
- Smart driving solutions segment became profitable for the first time, with revenue more than quintupling last year.
- Consumer products group saw a 38% revenue increase in 2024.
- The cloud computing division grew by 8.5%, aided by demand for AI services and US sanctions affecting Nvidia GPUs.
- Core telecommunications business grew by 5%, facing challenges from US partnerships limitations.

items.title: Ex-Apple chip engineer returns to China, takes role at university
items.summary:
- An ex-Apple chip engineer has returned to China.
- He has accepted a position at a university.
- The move emphasizes a trend of tech talent returning to China.

items.title: Amazon launches new AI agent platform
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Amazon launched [nova.amazon.com](https://www.techinasia.com/news/amazon-launches-new-ai-agent-platform) on Mar. 31, featuring advanced generative AI models called Amazon Nova.
- The platform includes a research preview of the Amazon Nova Act SDK for web browsers, enabling developers to create agents for searching and interacting with web interfaces.
- The Amazon Nova suite offers models for text generation (Nova Micro, Lite, Pro) and media generation (Nova Canvas, Nova Reel), integrated with Amazon Bedrock for scalable solutions.
- US customers can experiment with tools for text, image, and video generation via the Nova Act SDK by signing in with their Amazon account.

items.title: Chinese AI firm launches model, claims to outperform DeepSeek
items.summary:
- Zhipu AI launched a free AI agent named AutoGLM Rumination for web searches, travel planning, and reports.
- CEO Zhang Peng introduced the product using proprietary technologies like the GLM-Z1-Air model.
- Zhipu claims its GLM-Z1-Air outperforms DeepSeek’s R1 in speed and efficiency.
- The launch is part of a broader trend of AI product releases in China.
- AutoGLM Rumination is available for free, unlike Manus’ subscription model.
- Zhipu was established in 2019 from Tsinghua University and claims its GLM4 model surpasses OpenAI’s GPT-4.
- In March, Zhipu secured 300 million yuan in government-backed funding.

items.title: Intel CEO shifts to custom chips as struggles continue
items.summary:
- Intel's CEO is pivoting to focus on custom chips amid ongoing challenges.
- The shift aims to address market competitiveness and operational struggles.
- This strategy comes as Intel faces increasing pressure from competitors and changing market demands.

items.title: Israeli high-tech firms raised $2.1b in Q1 2025
items.summary:
- Israeli high-tech firms raised US$2.13 billion in Q1 2025, a 24% increase from the previous year.
- The cybersecurity sector contributed significantly, accounting for 25% of funding rounds and 42% of total capital.
- Major funding rounds included US$250 million for Rapyd and Island, which made up nearly a quarter of total capital raised.
- Overall funding growth was 8% compared to Q1 2024, despite a 10% drop in completed funding rounds (totaling 96).
- There was an increase in follow-on investments, indicating support for existing companies.
- Analysts suggest Google's acquisition of Wiz for US$32 billion has boosted confidence in the tech sector.
